column1: 48B6CCCE-3B83-4DBE-B4BC-E8580B260803#appfire#5216A8A4-D717-4274-BBFD-15A532E117D5#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-27 09:40:47.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-27 09:40:47.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#7E99FDA7-9335-4405-B13B-866C33729627#appfire#5216A8A4-D717-4274-BBFD-15A532E117D5#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-27 09:40:47.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-27 09:40:47.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#FE13057D-E0B0-453C-89F0-2370E2EA965B#appfire#5216A8A4-D717-4274-BBFD-15A532E117D5#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-27 09:40:47.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-27 09:40:47.0#appfire#1
